subject: Re: [junit] which jdk will work with JUnit on Redhat6.2?
msgSnippet: ... Sorry I didn t mean should be as in should already exist , I meant should be as in should be created if it doesn t already exist . It goes in
messageBody:
>I don't have a junit.properties file that I can find in my
> account. Where is yours located?

>>the junit.properties file (which should be in user.home).

Sorry I didn't mean "should be" as in "should already exist", I meant
"should be" as in "should be created if it doesn't already exist". It
goes in user.home (which on this computer is /u/sartin for me, YMMV :-)
which is the name of the Java property that specifies the home
directory of the User. On Windows it often winds up being something
stupid (like C:\). On Unix it should be $HOME, aka ~, aka the login
directory for the user.

The junit.properties file really needs better documentation.

Regards,

Rob
